title: Case Study: Congenital Clubfoot in a 6-Month-Old Infant
clinical_history: A 6-month-old male infant, born at 38 weeks gestation via cesarean section, presents with a congenital clubfoot deformity in his right foot. The parents first noticed the deformity at birth. The infant's foot is in a position of plantar flexion, inversion, and adduction, with a decreased ankle joint dorsiflexion range. The parents report that the infant experiences difficulty in moving his foot and has not shown any improvement over the past 6 months.
aggrevating_factors: Passive stretching of the foot and ankle, particularly in the direction of dorsiflexion and eversion
picture: An image of a 6-month-old infant's right foot showing clubfoot deformity
easing_factors: Gentle manipulation and mobilization of the foot and ankle
past_history: The infant has a family history of clubfoot, with a maternal aunt who had a similar condition. The infant has been otherwise healthy, with no other medical conditions or complications.
medical_history: The infant was born at 38 weeks gestation via cesarean section, with a birth weight of 3.2 kg. He has been followed up regularly by his pediatrician and has received routine vaccinations.
personal_history: The infant lives with his parents and has an older sibling who is 2 years old. The family has a supportive network of relatives and friends.
imaging: X-rays of the right foot and ankle showing a clubfoot deformity with a decreased talocalcaneal angle
